Text: Vision Focus GroupsIve attached the results of the focus groups as per my notes from the meetings Let me know if you need anything else

London All Employee MeetingForwarded by Mary ClarkCorpEnron on PM Lon Allchin AM To Mary NRON cc Subject London All Employee Meeting Mary I just wanted to let you know how great I thought the London meeting went using the IPTV technology I found it of very high quality and easy to use Most people in my department also tunedin for at least some portion of the program and all thought it was a resounding success A few folks who use laptops and docking stations did not have soundcards which meant they could see but not hear the presenters I and some others minimized the screen and continued or normal work while still listening to the audio Good Job We will be looking at this technology as another delivery option for our various training programs By the way here is the link for the EBS page which demonstrates what can be accomplished using the Enron Net Access this directly from the Enron Intranet home page Lon iedefaulthtm

Communicating California Cc are my ideas on how we should communicate our messages to employees Send an email from Ken and Jeff or maybe just Jeff about the events in California and what were doing about them This should be done right away During the next month or so while this is a hot issue we could give updates in every issue of eBiz thats every other week In April we could follow up with an indepth article in Enron Business Vol April about the issues in California and the status of all our deregulation efforts We could interview you Rick and other key employees who have been actively involved Its been a year since weve done this Hold a brown bag hosted by you or Rick We could videotape the event and put it on IPTV as well as offer copies of the video to employees who cant access IPTV ETV When an Enron executive testifies before the US Senate or other government body we could run it live replay it after the event We already did this with your testimony a couple of weeks ago that was replayed on CSPAN What about India There is an article in eBiz dated Feb but Im sure there are lots of questions about the future of this project I plan to plant a question for Jeff at the employee meeting We could plant a question about California as well You comments are welcome Mary
New Vision Communication Rollout Cc Ive attached our proposed plan Your comments are welcome Were looking at costs so we can estimate a budget for this Mary

Re ENE RETURN TO SHAREHOLDERS Cc a total return to shareholder slide at the beginning the presentation Comparing Enron to the SP it shows returns for one five and years taken from the Investor Conference slides The one below covers a broader comparison which helps to make our case right Margaret Carson AM To Mary NRON Rob NRON John NeslageENRON NRONDEVELOPMENT cc Steven J nron James D nron Subject ENE RETURN TO SHAREHOLDERS Mary Hope this is helpful regards Margaret

Internal Communications Metrics Cc re providing this information to you for the upcoming Board meeting per Marks request Let me know if you need anything else Internal Communications Metrics eSpeak Average live event participation ranges from participants to more than Transcript readership after the live event can reach more than eMeet Average daily visits have increased since stats were first captured in April More than employees have visited the site ThinkBank More than employees have visited the site since the launch in November business ideas are currently in the Idea Vault eThink Merchandise Before we even announced the online store in December we sold screen sweeps badges and apparel items and recouped only apparel is marked up eBiz Our average employee readership for was users and our average for so far is users On our last issue of eBiz we had hits and unique users ETV On average we are running segments of Enron content per week airing twice a day In January there were new segments created of Enron content and so far in February there have already been requests submitted Enron Business The average weekly readership of the online version has increased by since We continue to receive many requests for additional copies of the print version for marketing purposes etc In a survey the Enron Internal Communications team conducted in How do you generally read Enron Business EB print online both Do you ever share EB with your spouse or family yes no In a survey we conducted in How do you generally read EB read print read online read both The number of respondents in the readership survey was The number of respondents in was Recent Enron Accolades Fortunes Americas Most Admired Companies Most Innovative for sixth consecutive year Published Ranked No overall among companies up from No last year Popular Vote Not published Ranked No overall among companies down from No last year Total rating of in all eight attributes Not published No Citigroup No Omnicom No UPS Ranking in seven other attributes Quality of Management No We were No last year Omnicom No this year Quality of ProductsServices No Longterm investment value No Financial soundness No Employee talent No Social responsibility No Use of corporate assets No Overall industry results No This year were in the pipelineenergy industry expanded from just pipelines last year Fortunes Best Companies to Work for in America Enron ranked No up from No last year

Letter to Board Cc Kelly Ive attached the letter from Ken to the Board notifying them that we were named Most Innovative Company in America for the sixth consecutive year Ken has approved the letter and it contains his electronic signature Ive formated the letter and left room for names and addresses You can adjust as needed Please mail it at your earliest convenience Thanks Mary

Your corner on the intranet Cc Our Internal Communications group is continuing to look for ways to communicate with employees in a timely manner about hot topics that are of interest to them Were also looking to increase your exposure with employees We have a new idea which Sherri discussed briefly with you a couple of weeks ago Its called Jeffs Corner and it will be a regular video message that will be posted on the intranet which can be accessed by of our employees This is how it will work We will tape a minute video of you talking about whats top of mind at that moment The tone and style will be like your floor meetings one of your best employee venues casual and conversational We suggest the first topic be The State of Enron There is a lot of talk among employees about the cheap shots weve taken as a company and by you and Ken about the decline in our stock price and about the widespread redeployment efforts These recent events are beginning to affect morale Employees are concerned and want to be assured that were on the right side that they will have jobs that Enron will be here next year Youve helped reassure them about these things at recent floor meetings however that is only a small part of our global work force Having your own corner on the intranet will have a farther reach and we have the capability to do this inhouse at very low cost We recommend making this a regular communication feature at least monthly although since this would only involve a few minutes of your time you could even tape a message to employees weekly The nice thing about this medium is we have the ability to respond immediately to current events and having you speak to employees gives the message credibility Future topics could address new cost saving procedures update on Dabhol the PRC reasons behind an organizational announcement The Pulse survey etc Wed like this to be a forum where you can talk about topics youd like to discuss Ive checked with the technical team and we have the capability do this now I will check your calendar with Sherri Let me know if you have any questions Mary

FW Fortune study participants Cc Steve I requested the attached file from Mike Cacace of Fortune after Meredith and Vance told me they received a survey for this years Most Admired Companies the one that has ranked us most innovative for the past six years Did you select the people on this list It seems odd that Vance Meredith and Mark are included this year Also Rebecca Carter and Jeff Skilling should be deleted It appears that these surveys have already been mailed Original Message From ENRON Sent Monday October PM To Clark Mary Subject Fortune study participants Hi Mary Please find the attached list of executives and directors that are in our database for the Survey of Corporate Reputations Please review and advise if there are any changes There can be a maximum of executives and directors Thanks Tiffany See attached file Enronxls Enronxls
Our changesMary E Clark Director Internal Communications Phone Fax email

Employee meeting dates Cc Steve these are the available dates for an allemployee meeting From our meeting with HR today it appears we wont be having one next week We need to release these dates before the holiday The George R Brown Convention is not available through the end of the year Let me know what you decide Thanks Nov Tuesday Wortham Center in Cullen Auditorium holds Aerial Theatre holds Nov Thursday Hyatt Ballroom holds Dec Thursday Nothing available Dec Friday Wortham Center in Cullen Auditorium Dec Tuesday Hyatt Ballroom Mary E Clark Director Internal Communications Phone Fax email

FW Employee Memo re Changes to HR Policy and Employee Programs Cc Karen and Steve Terrie James and I thought it appropriate to communicate the severance decision separately from vacation and the other benefits and community changes in the email below which we planned to send out tomorrow Due to the time line HR has planned for next week we planned to send out the severance message Monday Can you give us some direction on this see Davids comment On another note what messages will the press release contain This came up a meeting Sarah and I had with the HR team today Thanks Original Message From Oxley David Sent Tuesday November PM To James Terrie Cash Michelle Clark Mary Johnson Rick Joyce Mary Barrow Cynthia Jones Robert W HR Exec Cc Olson Cindy Palmer Lizzette Sullivan Kriste Subject RE Employee Memo re Changes to HR Policy and Employee Programs We need to make sure the vacation component is tied in with severance decision which we havent yet concluded We need PR to help with deciding how we package these things Original Message From James Terrie Sent Tuesday November PM To Cash Michelle Clark Mary Johnson Rick Oxley David Joyce Mary Barrow Cynthia Jones Robert W HR Exec Cc Kalmans Elyse Kimberly Kelly Olson Cindy Palmer Lizzette Palmer Sarah Tobor Rachael Sullivan Kriste Subject Employee Memo re Changes to HR Policy and Employee Programs The attached memo is to be distributed to all USbased employees this afternoon Weve opted to include the various changes to HR policies and employee programs in one consolidated memo to reduce the number of negative emails employees receive over the next few weeks Please review at your earliest convenience and provide changes to me If I do not receive changes from you by pm today I will assume you have none Thanks for your prompt reply Terrie James Ext EB mailto File Policy change notice DRAFTdoc

Communicating California Cc are my ideas on how we should communicate our messages to employees Send an email from Ken and Jeff or maybe just Jeff about the events in California and what were doing about them This should be done right away During the next month or so while this is a hot issue we could give updates in every issue of eBiz thats every other week In April we could follow up with an indepth article in Enron Business Vol April about the issues in California and the status of all our deregulation efforts We could interview you Rick and other key employees who have been actively involved Its been a year since weve done this Hold a brown bag hosted by you or Rick We could videotape the event and put it on IPTV as well as offer copies of the video to employees who cant access IPTV ETV When an Enron executive testifies before the US Senate or other government body we could run it live replay it after the event We already did this with your testimony a couple of weeks ago that was replayed on CSPAN What about India There is an article in eBiz dated Feb but Im sure there are lots of questions about the future of this project I plan to plant a question for Jeff at the employee meeting We could plant a question about California as well You comments are welcome Mary

London All Employee MeetingForwarded by Mary ClarkCorpEnron on PM Lon Allchin AM To Mary NRON cc Subject London All Employee Meeting Mary I just wanted to let you know how great I thought the London meeting went using the IPTV technology I found it of very high quality and easy to use Most people in my department also tunedin for at least some portion of the program and all thought it was a resounding success A few folks who use laptops and docking stations did not have soundcards which meant they could see but not hear the presenters I and some others minimized the screen and continued or normal work while still listening to the audio Good Job We will be looking at this technology as another delivery option for our various training programs By the way here is the link for the EBS page which demonstrates what can be accomplished using the Enron Net Access this directly from the Enron Intranet home page Lon iedefaulthtm

Your corner on the intranet Cc Jeff Our Internal Communications group is continuing to look for ways to communicate with employees in a timely manner about hot topics that are of interest to them Were also looking to increase your exposure with employees We have a new idea which Sherri discussed briefly with you a couple of weeks ago Its called Jeffs Corner and it will be a regular video message that will be posted on the intranet which can be accessed by of our employees This is how it will work We will tape a minute video of you talking about whats top of mind at that moment The tone and style will be like your floor meetings one of your best employee venues casual and conversational We suggest the first topic be The State of Enron There is a lot of talk among employees about the cheap shots weve taken as a company and by you and Ken about the decline in our stock price and about the widespread redeployment efforts These recent events are beginning to affect morale Employees are concerned and want to be assured that were on the right side that they will have jobs that Enron will be here next year Youve helped reassure them about these things at recent floor meetings however that is only a small part of our global work force Having your own corner on the intranet will have a farther reach and we have the capability to do this inhouse at very low cost We recommend making this a regular communication feature at least monthly although since this would only involve a few minutes of your time you could even tape a message to employees weekly The nice thing about this medium is we have the ability to respond immediately to current events and having you speak to employees gives the message credibility Future topics could address new cost saving procedures update on Dabhol the PRC reasons behind an organizational announcement The Pulse survey etc Wed like this to be a forum where you can talk about topics youd like to discuss Ive checked with the technical team and we have the capability do this now I will check your calendar with Sherri Let me know if you have any questions Mary
